title: (x) Looking for non-distressed version of Papyrus - various alternatives {Mike Y}
content:
First of all, I apologize in advance if I put this in the wrong forum. I am searching for a font in the same style as the font Papyrus, that is not distressed. Can anyone give me words of wise guidance on where something like this might live? Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Papyrus_4494.gif)
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content:
I think Rick Mueller's [Parchment](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/mueller/g_q.htm) at TypOasis may be undistressed, and Scriptorium has a Papyrus-like font called Ereshkigal (may be distressed) and 3 Islands Press has Fidelma, a similar, undistressed style.

- Mike Yanega

Here is a link for [Fidelma](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/lillie/fidelma/). It is irregular, but not 'eroded' like Papyrus.

- Mike Yanega

Here is David Nalle's [Ereshkigal](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/ereshkigal/), a somewhat modified take on Papyrus (the A is different at least), complete with similar erosions to look like it was written on its original's namesake writing material.

- Mike Yanega

Chris Costello, designer of Papyrus, is working on a non-distressed version. You might e-mail him an find out if any is available yet.

Here is the link: [http://www.costelloart.com/costello.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/www.costelloart.com/costello.html "http://www.costelloart.com/costello.html")
In with FontShop's [Papyrus alternatives list](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/papyrus/) before Stephen!

A free font, but very interesting in my opinion:  
 [Epistolar](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113201135/http:/masklin8.deviantart.com/art/Epistolar-font-95506900)

--- Tamas Ferencz ---
A non-distressed Papyrus? Adobe Present comes close.
